title: 107_hr2313
content: The Act may be cited as the "Crane Tithe Tax Act of 2001" and repeals the taxation of corporations. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is repealed, including provisions related to corporate income tax, alternative minimum tax for corporations, unrelated business income tax, accumulated earnings tax, personal holding company tax, alternative tax for certain mutual savings banks, tax imposed on life insurance companies, tax imposed on certain mutual insurance companies, tax on certain other insurance companies, and tax on regulated investment companies. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is repealed, including provisions related to various taxes on insurance companies, regulated investment companies, real estate investment trusts, and foreign corporations with US business connections. SEC. 3. 10 PERCENT INCOME TAX RATE FOR INDIVIDUALS. Amendment to Section 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose a 10 percent income tax rate for individuals. A 10 percent income tax is imposed on individuals based on earned income exceeding the exemption amount, which is $10,000 adjusted for the cost of living. The cost-of-living adjustment for any calendar year is based on the percentage difference between the Consumer Price Index (CPI) for October of the preceding year and the CPI for October of 2000. Any increase not a multiple of $10 is rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The cost-of-living adjustment is based on the CPI difference between October of the preceding year and October of 2000. Any increase not a multiple of $10 is rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Earned income includes wages, self-employment earnings, and certain dividends. Earned income for the taxable year includes wages, self-employment earnings, and certain dividends. Exceptions to earned income are pension or annuity payments, tips not at the discretion of the recipient, and fringe benefits valued at employer cost. SEC. 4 grants amnesty for all prior tax liability before January 1, 2000, under the Internal Revenue Code. Exceptions include amounts paid before the enactment of the Act and taxes related to illegal activities. SEC. 5 repeals special deductions, credits, and income exclusions for individuals. SEC. 5 repeals special deductions, credits, and income exclusions for individuals. SEC. 6 repeals estate and gift taxes. SEC. 7 specifies effective dates. The amendments made by this Act apply to taxable years starting after enactment. Repeal of estate and gift taxes applies to estates of decedents dying after enactment. The Secretary of the Treasury must submit technical changes to the Internal Revenue Code within 90 days of enactment.
